articles.title: Greetings to Zambian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Zambian President
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Edgar Lungu, president of the Republic of Zambia, on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of independence of his country.
					 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Zambia would grow stronger, Kim in his message sincerely wished the president and people of Zambia bigger successes in their works for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK FM Statement Distributed as Official Document of UNSC
articles.content:
DPRK FM Statement Distributed as Official Document of UNSC
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A statement issued by the Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on Oct. 17 as regards the proposal for concluding a peace treaty was distributed as UN Security Council's official document S/2015/799.

articles.title: German Delegation Here
articles.content:
German Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the German Asia-Pacific Business Association headed by Executive Member Timo Prekop arrived here Saturday.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association led by Vice Chairman Kenki Nakamura left here for home Saturday.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the New Socialist Party of Japan led by Secretary General of its Central Headquarters Hirokuni Osanami left here for home on Saturday.

articles.title: Sojourn of German Delegation
articles.content:
Sojourn of German Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the German-Korean Parliamentary Friendship Group led by Chairman Hartmut Koschyk visited the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					 Being briefed on the monument signifying the immortal ideological and theoretical feats of President Kim Il Sung, they looked round the tower and sculptures and enjoyed a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang City on the observation deck of the tower.
					
					 They toured the e-library of Kim Il Sung University, the Central Zoo and other places.

articles.title: Sixth District of Ryongmaedo Tideland Reclamation Project Completed
articles.content:
Sixth District of Ryongmaedo Tideland Reclamation Project Completed 
						
 Chongdan, October 23 (KCNA) -- The sixth district of the project for reclaiming Ryongmaedo tideland was completed. 
					 The Ryongmaedo tideland reclamation is a great structure in the era of Songun built thanks to the noble patriotic desire of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to expand the land of the country and enable the Korean people to enjoy wellbeing generation after generation and the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 The completion of the sixth district of the project for reclaiming tideland made it possible to obtain more than a thousand of hectares of new land for agricultural production and change the map of the country. 
					
					 There took place a ceremony of completion on the spot on Friday. 
					
					 Present there were Ri Chol Man, vice-premier of the Cabinet and minister of Agriculture, Ri Ung Chol, director of the Tideland Reclamation Guidance Bureau, officials concerned and officials and builders of the South Hwanghae Provincial Tideland Reclamation Complex. 
					
					 An address was made at the ceremony. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants went round the completed sixth district of the project.

articles.title: Performance Given by Art Squad of C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League
articles.content:
Performance Given by Art Squad of C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Members of the youth shock brigade and builders who performed labor feats in the construction of the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station, officials and other people of the relevant units who contributed to the completion of the power station enjoyed performance "Song of Youth Following the Sun" given by the Art Squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers such as small choruses "Song of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League" and "Joy of the People".
					
					 The performers enthusiastically sang of the pride and honor of the service personnel and people holding in high esteem President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who trained the youth as revolutionary vanguard fighters steadfastly carrying forward the lineage of Juche as eternal leaders.
					
					 They impressively depicted the personality of Marshal Kim Jong Un as a great man in narrative poem and male solo "Golden Cushion", poem and story-telling "Care of the Great Sun" and other numbers.

articles.title: Kangryong Grasswork Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
Kangryong Grasswork Popular in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Various kinds of goods, produced by the Kangryong Grasswork Factory in South Hwanghae Province of the DPRK, are winning popularity among citizens.
					 The factory turns out scores of kinds of grasswork with sedge and other locally available materials. Typical of its products are hat, basket and cushion.
					
					 In recent years it has increased the variety of sedge products, including bags, mats and wall hangings depicting pine tree, tiger and crane.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un recognized a sedge carpet, one of its products, in August when he visited the Pyongyang Home for the Aged.
					
					 O Son Gum, manager of the factory, told KCNA that the factory has striven to steadily improve its products so as to suit the consumers' aesthetic taste.

articles.title: Super Absorbent Polymer Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Super Absorbent Polymer Developed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Researchers of Kim Il Sung University recently developed super absorbent polymer and introduced it into the fields of agriculture and forestry.
					 The polymer can absorb water weighing 500-800 times heavier than its mass.
					
					 According to Rim Yong Son, a department head of the University, the introduction of newly-developed polymer has shown good results.
					
					 When fertilizer coated with this polymer is put on paddy and non-paddy fields, it helps keep wetness in soil for 10-15 days and heighten the effect of fertilizer. It can also raise the rate of rooting twice in planting trees when their roots are covered with the polymer.
					
					 The researchers are now working hard to expand the sphere of its application.

articles.title: Papers Urge U.S. to Respond to DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Papers Urge U.S. to Respond to DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty 
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. is the primary issue of ensuring peace and security of not only on the Korean Peninsula but also in other parts of the world, say leading newspapers here Saturday.
					 The issue of preserving peace and security on the peninsula is directly linked with the issue of ensuring global peace and security, and global peace and security would have been unthinkable apart from peace and security on the peninsula, says Rodong Sinmun in an article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty is the issue that requires the DPRK and the U.S. to sit face to face and reach a principled agreement.
					
					 The issue of replacing the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty should be discussed by the officials concerned of the DPRK and the U.S. 
					
					 The U.S. has talked volumes about the "peace" and "detente" in Korea so far.
					
					 If the U.S. truly wants the reunification of the Korean nation and peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and other parts of the world, it should roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and respond to the proposal for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK.
					
					 Everything hinges on the attitude of the U.S. towards the matter.
					
					 If the U.S. refuses to conclude a peace treaty and insists on its hostile policy, it will only meet the resistance of the powerful revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to carefully approach the DPRK's proposal and take a responsible option.
					
					 Minju Joson notes in a commentary that the replacement of the Korean AA by a peace treaty is a prerequisite to putting a definite end to the vicious cycle of escalating confrontation and tension on the peninsula and building a groundwork for lasting peace on the peninsula.

articles.title: UN Has to Get Rid of Anachronistic Concept and Prejudice: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
UN Has to Get Rid of Anachronistic Concept and Prejudice: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- At present the issue of the reform of the UN has become an urgent issue for the member nations that can never be postponed because the UN has not satisfactorily fulfilled its mission, being seized by anachronistic old order, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article.
					 The UN Security Council's anachronistic old concept and prejudice find their vivid manifestation in the situation created on the Korean Peninsula, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The situation on the peninsula reached the brink of a war in last August.
					
					 By exercising its right as a member nation specified in the UN Charter the DPRK referred the aggressive and provocative large-scale joint military exercises staged by the U.S. and south Korea to the UN Security Council, branding them as acts of jeopardizing the world peace and security.
					
					 But the UN Security Council kept mum about it.
					
					 Its stand was that as the joint military exercises were spearheaded by a permanent member of the UN Security Council, it can not but close its eyes and stop its ears and mouth no matter how huge the exercises are in their scale and no matter how aggressive and dangerous they may be in their purpose and nature.
					
					 The UN can never fulfill its mission of safeguarding the international peace and security unless the international relations are democratized in the true sense of the words.
					
					 Instead, the UN will be a body hiding and defending the forces disturbing peace and security.
					
					 The UN should no longer be misused as a body for abusing sovereignty, dignity, peace and security of the member nations.
					
					 It has to get rid of anachronistic concept and prejudice at an early date and represent the will of the member nations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules "Talks" between Military Authorities of S. Korea and Japan
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules "Talks" between Military Authorities of S. Korea and Japan
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- There took place so-called "talks" between the defense ministers of south Korea and Japan in Seoul on Oct. 20.
					 The south Korean authorities requested a prior consent in case of the advance of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" to the area of north Korea under the pretext of "sovereignty". The Japanese side turned down this request, in fact, claiming the area over which south Korea's effective jurisdiction is exercised is the area south of the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Saturday ridicules their "talks" as a senseless argument.
					
					 Those who are no more than war servants of the U.S. talked rubbish, daring have an eye to the inviolable territory of the dignified DPRK, unaware of their awkward position and tragic fate. This has only aroused derision of the public at home and abroad, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 At the "talks" the U.S.-Japan-south Korea tripartite cooperation was mentioned, awakening the public to the danger of the triangular military alliance for aggression on the DPRK, pursuant to the U.S. scenario.
					
					 Shortly ago, the south Korean chief executive talked about "urgency of the solution of the north's nuclear issue" during her visit to her American master and Obama expressed sympathy. But all facts go to prove that what the U.S., Japan and the south Korean authorities are pushing forward as a priority is the tightened triangular military alliance for the provocation of a new war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The developments clearly prove who is a provoker and warmonger bringing the dark clouds of a war of aggression while standing against dialogue and peace.
					
					 Those hell-bent on war drumbeats, being seized by the ambition for "advance into the area of north Korea" had better behave themselves, pondering over the catastrophic consequences they will cause to the Korean Peninsula and the north-south relations, warns the commentary.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Calls for Heightening Vigilance against Japan's Rapid Emergence as Nuclear Weapons State
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Calls for Heightening Vigilance against Japan's Rapid Emergence as Nuclear Weapons State 
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Japan is rapidly emerging a nuclear weapons state under the signboard of "the Pacifist Constitution".
					 Now Japan has a stockpile of tremendous amount of plutonium and enriched uranium enough to manufacture more than 5 000 nuclear bombs.
					
					 Amid increasing international concern and suspicion about Japan going nuclear, the Chinese arms control and disarmament council and academic organization jointly published a report on Japan's nuclear materials and the Carnegie International Peace Foundation of the U.S. also published an academic report on Japan's nuclear materials.
					
					 The reports cited facts to prove that Japan holds a stockpile of sensitive nuclear substances, revealing the danger of nuclear proliferation and threat to nuclear security.
					
					 Japan has the world's largest fuel reprocessing plant and has stored 50 tons of split plutonium for decades which mean astronomical figures for the overwhelming majority of the countries in the world. It has massively conducted study of modern nuclear technology including nuclear fusion and high-speed neutron reactor and has purchased, stored and extracted a huge amount of nuclear substance.
					
					 Going nuclear is Japan's invariable ambition and becoming a military giant is its strategic goal. Back in the Second World War, Japan pursued the development of a nuclear weapon and its use but instead it suffered from nuclear disasters. Finding the reason for its defeat in the war in its failure to have access to nuclear weapons, the militarists considered nuclear weapons as an all-powerful weapons and worked hard to have access to them.
					
					 In order to create social atmosphere and legal environment necessary for nuclear weaponization, Japan revised "the basic law on atomic energy" and has openly pursued nuclear weaponization under the pretext of "national security."
					
					 At an event this year, 70 years since Hiroshima suffered from an A-bomb, the Japanese chief executive did not mention the "three non-nuclear principles" which he would tout for mere form's sake in the past.
					
					 But the Japanese right-wing elements have desperately stood against the principles, openly crying out for "manufacturing A-bombs".
					
					 Japan's access to nuclear weapons has already become a will of the government, not just demand of a few ultra-right elements.
					
					 Japan is capable of producing nuclear warheads in a short period as it has fully acquired technology of manufacturing A-bombs.
					
					 Japan's going nuclear is neither a prediction nor a hypothesis but its danger is becoming a reality.
					
					 All facts prove Japan's dramatic change in its foreign security policy with nuclear weapons as a pivot.
					
					 Japan's moves for nuclear weaponization are related to the ambition for overseas aggression and war for world domination of the descendents of the war-happy militarists who are oblivious of the lesson of history.
					
					 The world has to heighten vigilance against Japan's moves for nuclear weaponization that brought such a horrible disaster to humankind in the last century.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers' Large-Scale Drill for Aggression Slammed
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers' Large-Scale Drill for Aggression Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Ronald Reagan, nuclear carrier of the U.S. imperialist aggressors, Friday kicked off the drill for aggression against the DPRK, together with the south Korean military warmongers in waters off Pusan, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 Patrol planes, helicopters and fighters were involved in the provocative large-scale combined naval maneuver.
					
					 Meanwhile, a naval special flotilla was busy with a drill against terrorism and marines conducted a landing operation drill for occupying areas of the north in a coordinated operation with ground, naval and air forces.
					
					 The situation on the Korean Peninsula is again growing tense owing to this madcap saber-rattling.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Humiliating Diplomacy under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Humiliating Diplomacy under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- South Korean online paper Voice of People on Oct. 22 in an editorial denounced the authorities' humiliating diplomatic policy towards outside forces. 
					 The authorities were subject to humiliation by the U.S. over the transfer of technology concerning the introduction of fighters, the editorial said, adding that this time they were hit hard by Japan.
					
					 When the south Korean minister of Defence said that the Japan "Self-Defence Forces" should get consent from south Korea in case of their advance into the area of north Korea, Japan held that south Korea's jurisdiction is in force only over the area south of the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 All this is attributable to the humiliating diplomacy of the authorities reading the faces of the U.S. and Japan.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Respond to Call for Implementing Inter-Korean Agreement
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Respond to Call for Implementing Inter-Korean Agreement
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a statement on Oct. 22 urged the south Korean authorities to sincerely respond to the call for the implementation of the north-south agreement.
					 The statement said the south Korean authorities should value the spirit of the agreement reached at the south-north high-level urgent contact.
					
					 The implementation of the agreement should start from the lifting of the "May 24 step" blocking the exchange and cooperation between the south and the north, it noted.
					
					 If the authorities want to make substantial contribution to developing the south-north relations, they should refrain from obstructing civilian exchange in various fields of the south and the north, it said.
					
					 It urged the authorities to positively opt for implementing the agreement.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Obstructing NGOs Exchange
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Obstructing NGOs Exchange
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration released a statement on Oct. 22 denouncing the south Korean authorities for obstructing the NGOs exchange between the north and the south.
					 The statement said that the youth and students in the south positively hail the joint press release of the south-north high-level urgent contact which agreed to energize NGOs exchange in various fields and are working to carry it out.
					
					 It demanded the authorities stop the unreasonable control over NGOs exchange and ensure the exchange of people of all social standings according to the south-north agreement.

articles.title: Bird Flu Occurs at Duck Farm, S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Occurs at Duck Farm, S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Ducks were confirmed to be infected with bird flu virus at a duck farm in Ryongam, South Jolla Province, south Korea on Oct. 22, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 It was reported that lots of ducks were culled and buried.

articles.title: WPK's Founding Anniversary Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
WPK's Founding Anniversary Celebrated Abroad 
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A reception was given in Iran, round-table talks were held in Mexico, friendly gathering in Zimbabwe and film show in South Africa from October 6 to 15 in celebration of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Also displayed there were books and photos dealing with the successes achieved by the Korean people in the revolution and construction under the leadership of the WPK. 
					
					 The executive secretary of the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran said in his speech Kim Il Sung was the great revolutionary and staunch fighter who made distinguished contributions to the history of struggle against imperialism. 
					
					 The vice general secretary of the above-said party said Kim Il Sung fathered the Juche idea and successfully embodied it and Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological power and military power by pursuing the unique Songun politics, thereby firmly protecting the sovereignty of the country. 
					
					 He expressed his will to boost the friendship and ties between the two parties. 
					
					 The participants in the events held in Mexico and Zimbabwe praised the undying leadership exploits performed by the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu for party building and expressed support and solidarity for the just cause of the WPK and the Korean people. 
					
					 Korean films "Songdowon International Children's Camp" and "Masikryong Ski Resort" were shown at the film show held at the Pretoria City Library of South Africa.

articles.title: WPK's 70-Year History Introduced in India, Senegal
articles.content:
WPK's 70-Year History Introduced in India, Senegal 
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Media of India and Senegal carried special write-ups or aired special programs to mark the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 The paper Indian and World Event on October 5 dedicated its two whole pages to an article "Ever-victorious WPK" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 It said the WPK, guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, achieved steel-like unity of all its members and enjoys absolute support and trust from the people. 
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is successfully carrying forward the exploits performed by the great leaders in party building, it added. 
					
					 Another Indian paper New Delhi Times on October 9 said in an article that the DPRK is the people's country as its nomenclature denotes. 
					
					 The DPRK guided by the Juche idea, people-first doctrine, is the genuine country of people fully guaranteeing all their rights and dignity, the paper stressed. 
					
					 The Senegalese paper Le Populaire on October 8 carried an article titled "70 years of leading people" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Over the past 70 years the WPK has led the people to victory as a guiding force of society, weathering severe test of history, the paper said, adding that the WPK built a prosperous socialist power by enlisting the inexhaustible strength of the people. 
					
					 The Senegalese state radio broadcasting on October 7 introduced the sacred 70-year history of the WPK which has led the army and people to victory and glory.

articles.title: WPK's 70th Anniversary Observed by Foreign Political Parties
articles.content:
WPK's 70th Anniversary Observed by Foreign Political Parties  
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Organs of foreign political parties carried special articles from October 9 to 13 to mark the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 The organ of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola carried an article titled "WPK significantly celebrating 70th founding anniversary" illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The article said the WPK is guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism the essence of which is the Juche idea, Songun idea, and the Korean revolution has recorded an ever-victorious history under the banner of the Juche idea, Songun idea. 
					
					 Al Ahrar, the organ of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt, carried articles under the headline "70 years of leading people" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 La Juventud, the organ of the March 26 Movement of Uruguay, in an article titled  "Party enjoying support from people" said the WPK is working hard to realize the ideal and dream of the people under the uplifted banner of people-first. 
					
					 All the achievements in the DPRK would be unthinkable without the wise leadership of the WPK, the article noted. 
					
					 The New Worker, the organ of the New Communist Party of Britain, in an article said Kim Jong Un, successor to the cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, is wisely leading the Korean people in the drive for building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Urge U.S. to Respond to DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Urge U.S. to Respond to DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Oct. 18 in support of the statement of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK.
					 The statement recalled that the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK issued a statement on Oct. 17 in which it re-clarified its fair and aboveboard stand to replace the Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) by a peace treaty at the 70th UN General Assembly. 
					
					 The issue of replacing the AA by a peace treaty is the one which requires the U.S. to take the plunge first and the DPRK and the U.S. should reach a principled agreement on it, to begin with, the statement said, and went on: 
					
					 The UN, too, should positively support the conclusion of a peace treaty so as to put an end to the abnormal situation where its member country is technically at war with the "UN Command" on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 If the U.S. sidesteps the conclusion of a peace treaty and puts up a conditionality on it, it will fully reveal in the eyes of the world that it has no will to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 If the U.S. persistently pursues the hostile policy toward the DPRK, it DPRK will bolster up its nuclear deterrence.
					
					 The U.S. response to the conclusion of a peace treaty will meet its interests, too.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Zambia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Zambia
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 24 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Zambia, Edgar Lungu, con motivo del 51o aniversario de la independencia de este pais africano.
					Convencido de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas las magnificas relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre Corea y Zambia, el remitente desea de todo corazon al destinatario y a su pueblo mayores exitos en su labor para el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Distribuida declaracion de MINREX de RPDC como documento oficial de ONU
articles.content:
Distribuida declaracion de MINREX de RPDC como documento oficial de ONU
						
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo distribuida el dia 22 como documento oficial S/2015/799 del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU la declaracion del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fechada 17 relativa a la propuesta de la firma del convenio de la paz.

articles.title: Constructores de central electrica presencian funcion artistica
articles.content:
Constructores de central electrica presencian funcion artistica 
						
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Los miembros de la Brigada Juvenil y otros constructores, quienes han hecho hazanas laborales en la construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica Jovenes Heroes Paektusan y los funcionarios de las unidades correspondientes y trabajadores quienes contribuyeron a la terminacion de dicha central, presenciaron la funcion "Cancion de jovenes siguiendo al Sol" ofrecida por el grupo central de propaganda artistica juvenil.
					En la escena se pusieron el coro "Cancion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung" y "Jubilo del pueblo", el quinteto con acompanamiento de guitarra "Es radiante nuestro futuro", la cancion y baile y el trio de instrumentos nacionales "Es mejor nuestra nacion", la agitacion y monologo "Escuela revolucionaria de jovenes" y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes cantaron con tono sublime la dignidad del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea de sostener como lideres eternos al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il quienes formaron a los jovenes como vanguardistas de la revolucion para continuar firmemente el linaje de Juche.
					
					Describieron con gran emocion los rasgos nobles del Mariscal Kim Jong Un en la narracion de poesia y solo masculino "Cojin de oro", la narracion de poesia "Regazo del gran Sol" y otras piezas.
					
					En la escena se pusieron la armonica y coro mixto "Adelante los jovenes, siguiendo al partido", la charla comica "Nombre de Juventud", el cuarteto masculino "Iremos al monte Paektu" y otras piezas.
